page.title: 02The Hampshire Chronicle
page.content: "The Hampshire Chronicle" has been going for 213 years.This weekly paper serves the Winchester area with a circulation of about 24,000 .It is a family owned paper.They use "Hot Metal Linotype" machines to make type.This is produced by casting a line which is typed in on a keyboard.They recycle the metal and use it again and again . Pages are put together in the chase , they push all the type together to make a page on the stone and flatten it with a mallet.Then it is corrected in the readers room but it is hard because they have to read it back to front.The large printing machines can print up to 3500 papers per hour , 4 pages both sides at a time.The 5.1/2 mile long rolls of newsprint are cut and folded by the machine.The size of paper depends on the advertisements.No one wants "The Chronicle" to change.
